medical_history.chief_complaint: Aggravation of partial epilepsy and emergence of new seizure type.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's intractable occipital lobe epilepsy began at age 10. During a 3-month baseline period before VNS implantation, she averaged 15 complex partial seizures (CPS) per month and had daily simple partial seizures (SPS). After VNS implantation, CPS frequency was reduced by 40%, but two days after increasing the stimulation current, the patient experienced daily CPS and new seizure type with thrashing and kicking movements, occurring up to four times per day.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Intractable occipital lobe epilepsy since age 10, mild learning disability; medical history otherwise unremarkable.
